request_pathways.name: HIPAA Authorization for Disclosure of Health Information (Form 8691-04)

access_pathway.primary_pathway_description: Patients use a system-wide Avera Health HIPAA authorization form designed for third-party release of records, filling in themselves as the recipient.

red_flags: Requests last 4 digits of SSN, which is not required by HIPAA for patient access
Witness signature line present without clarification of whether it is required or optional
No submission instructions printed on the form itself
bright_spots: Multiple electronic delivery format options: paper, fax, flash drive, CD-ROM, email with encryption by default
Explicit citation of 45 CFR 164.524 (HIPAA Right of Access)
Single-page form covering all required authorization elements

findability.rationale: Level 3: requires moderate effort — form is not linked from the facility profile page; patients must navigate to the parent system's medical records page or perform a web search.

technical_accessibility.rationale: Level 2: primarily a paper workflow — the PDF has zero fillable fields, requiring patients to print and handwrite; fax submission is available but not clearly indicated on the form itself.

content_design.rationale: Level 3: adequate but has notable issues — the single-page layout with labeled sections is functional, but the form is visually dense, mixes plain language with regulatory references, and lacks patient-facing instructions.

patient_centeredness.rationale: Level 2: patient self-access is an afterthought — the form is a generic third-party authorization that does not differentiate individual access from release to insurers or attorneys; patients must adapt the form to their self-access use case.

compliance.rationale: Level 3: some requirements beyond what the law requires — SSN collection (even last 4 digits) is unnecessary for patient access, ambiguous witness signature line may create barriers, and fee disclosure is vague ('charges may apply' with no amounts).

overall.summary: Avera Hand County Memorial provides a functional but generic third-party authorization form with no patient-specific access pathway, non-fillable fields, and several unnecessary friction points partially offset by strong delivery format options.
